term.title: Haber–Weiss reaction

item.text: The Haber–Weiss cycle consists of the following two reactions:,H2O2 + OH.H2O + O2− + H+ and,H2O2 + O2−O2 + OH− + OH.,The second reaction achieved notoriety as a possible source of hydroxyl radicals. However, it has a negligible rate constant. It is believed that iron(III) complexes can catalyse this reaction: first, Fe(III) is reduced by superoxide, followed by oxidation by dihydrogen peroxide.

sources.item: PAC, 1997, 69, 1251. 'Glossary of terms used in bioinorganic chemistry (IUPAC Recommendations 1997)' on page 1277 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199769061251)
